title: After Putin call, Trump says Russia and Ukraine to start ‘immediate’ talks on ceasefire
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that Russia and Ukraine “will immediately start negotiations” toward a ceasefire and an end to their three-year-old war, speaking after he held a call with Russia’s President Vladimir Putin.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall of about 75 mm expected
byline: The Department of Meteorology says South-West monsoon conditions are gradually getting established over the island.

title: HRCSL issues general guidelines and recommendations for Sri Lanka Police
byline: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has released a set of general guidelines and recommendations aimed at preventing deaths in police custody and in confrontations with the police.

title: Israel lets aid into Gaza after 11-week blockade but UN calls it ‘drop in ocean’
byline: Israel says it has allowed five UN lorries carrying humanitarian aid, including baby food, into the Gaza Strip after 11 weeks of blockade.

title: Suspect arrested for multiple three-wheeler thefts
byline: A suspect wanted in connection with the theft of multiple three-wheelers has been arrested by Police.

title: Netflix strikes deal to bring Sesame Street to streaming giant
byline: Sesame Street and Netflix have struck a deal that will see the popular US television show appear on the streaming platform, while still being available on the free-to-air channel PBS.

title: Excise officers accused of soliciting bribes from liquor license holders
byline: The Sri Lanka Liquor Licensees’ Association has accused certain excise officers of allegedly demanding bribes from liquor license holders to maintain their establishments.

title: Parties and independent groups yet to name all its members for LG bodies
byline: Details of around 40% of the members elected to local government bodies following the conduct of the 2025 Local Government (LG) election have not been submitted to the respective District Returning Officers, Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Ratnayake has stated.

title: Parliamentary session begins
byline: The Parliamentary session commenced at 9:30 a.m. today (20).

title: Three women arrested with ‘Kush’ worth Rs. 120mn at BIA
byline: Three women have been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle Rs. 120 million worth of ‘Kush’ cannabis into the country.

title: Two sluice gates of Thabbowa Reservoir opened
byline: Two sluice gates of the Thabbowa Reservoir have been opened following heavy rains in the area, the Department of Irrigation said.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella produced before Court
byline: Former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, who has been arrested and remanded in connection with three cases filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), has been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court by prison officials today (20).

title: ‘Meenagaya’ train derails after colliding with elephant
byline: The ‘Meenagaya’ Intercity Express train, which was operating from Colombo Fort to Batticaloa, has derailed.

title: ‘Sisu Sariya’ bus driver arrested for driving under influence of alcohol
byline: A school bus driver has been arrested for driving under the influence of alcohol, according to Sri Lanka Police.

title: UK, France and Canada threaten action against Israel over Gaza
byline: The UK, France and Canada have warned Israel they will take “concrete actions” if it continues an “egregious” expansion of military operations in Gaza.

title: Bribery Commission files indictment against ex-Minister Chandrani Bandara
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has filed an indictment before the Colombo High Court against former Minister Chandrani Bandara, alleging abuse of power and corruption during her tenure as Minister of Women and Child Affairs and Dry Zone Development.

title: Govt to recruit 186 immigration officers to expand passport services
byline: A total of 186 officers will be recruited to the Department of Immigration and Emigration in order to expand services related to the issuance of passports, Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala said in Parliament today (20).

title: Former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella further remanded
byline: Former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella has been further remanded until June 3, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Inquiry committee rejects preliminary objections by Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: The Committee of Inquiry to inquire and report its findings on Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power has dismissed the preliminary objections raised on behalf of the respondent IGP, according to the Parliamentary Communications Department.

title: TIN to be made mandatory when opening bank accounts under new tax law amendments
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal to initiate necessary amendments to the Inland Revenue Act No. 24 of 2017 in order to make it mandatory to furnish the Tax Identification Number (TIN) when opening all types of bank accounts.

title: Appeals Court dismisses contempt charges against Sports Director General over rugby elections
byline: The Court of Appeal today (20) dismissed a contempt of court case filed against the Director General of Sports over his alleged failure to conduct elections for Sri Lanka Rugby, as per an agreement previously reached before the Colombo District Court.

title: Cabinet approves “Take Care – Surakimu Magathota” school road safety project
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the implementation of the project “Take Care – Surakimu Magathota” (Take Care – Let’s Ensure Road Safety).

title: Vietnamese beauty queen arrested for fraud over fibre gummies
byline: Vietnamese authorities have arrested a beauty queen and social media influencer for consumer fraud after she promoted a counterfeit fibre supplement.

title: ‘Really dangerous’: Warning for potentially deadly flash floods in Eastern Australia
byline: Residents on the northern New South Wales coast have been warned of potentially life-threatening flash flooding as heavy falls and strong winds continue to lash the state.

title: Hearing of case against ‘Harak Kata’ adjourned
byline: The Colombo High Court has adjourned the hearing of the case filed against Nandun Chinthaka Wickramaratne, alias “Harak Kata” — a high-profile suspect linked to drug trafficking and organized crime — in connection with a violent robbery that was reported in Mulleriyawa in 2015.

title: We waged war to establish peace in the country: Ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says the government led by him waged war to liberate the country and establish lasting peace.

title: “2025 Tea for Harmony: Yaji” series events kick off in Colombo
byline: The China Cultural Center in Sri Lanka held a media briefing for the “2025 Tea for Harmony: Yaji” series events recently.

title: PM Harini receives death threats via email; IP addresses traced to Europe - Minister
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has received death threats to her official email address at the Prime Minister’s Office, the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala revealed in Parliament today (20).

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in six districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in six districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Woman arrested for carrying T-56 firearm into apartment complex in Havelock Town
byline: A woman has reportedly been seen carrying a T-56 assault rifle into her home at a prominent apartment complex in Havelock Town, Police said.

title: CC to decide on new Auditor General today
byline: A decision on the appointment of the new Auditor General will be made today, Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has announced in Parliament.

title: Investigation underway after elephant killed by train despite recent safety measures
byline: A Sri Lankan express train killed an elephant and was derailed on Tuesday despite safety measures introduced after the country’s worst wildlife railway accident three months ago on the same route.

title: Deputy Minister explains how duty is imposed on vehicles
byline: The value of the vehicle is not the determining factor when imposing taxes, Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma said in Parliament today (20).

title: Dense fog disrupts traffic in Nuwara Eliya
byline: Vehicular movement has been affected due to dense fog prevailing along several roads heading towards the Nuwara Eliya city, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: India’s ‘Silicon Valley’ flooded after heavy rains
byline: Parts of the southern Indian city of Bengaluru, often called India’s Silicon Valley are under water after heavy rainfall.

title: US Embassy in Colombo warns of ‘fake’ social media accounts impersonating its officials
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka has warned the general public of a recent spike in social media accounts impersonating its officials based in Colombo.

title: New Zealand’s Deputy PM to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of New Zealand Winston Peters will visit Sri Lanka, Nepal, India and Australia later this week, the New Zealand government has announced.

title: Presidential Secretariat donates 5 vehicles to rehabilitation centers for differently-abled war heroes
byline: A total of five vehicles that were required by rehabilitation centers maintained for differently-abled war heroes have been handed over to the Ranaviru Seva Authority, the President’s Media Division said in a statement.

title: Two jailors and driver of Angunakolapelessa Prison suspended
byline: Two jailors and a prison driver attached to Angunakolapelessa Prison have been suspended pending an investigation regarding an incident where a bus belonging to the prison was parked at a location outside the Weligama town with an inmate and his family members inside on May 16.

title: President appoints committee to probe allegations of irregularities in SriLankan Airlines
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed the relevant authorities to appoint a special committee, led by the Presidential Secretariat, to investigate alleged corruption and irregularities at SriLankan Airlines.

title: Women’s jobs face higher AI risk than men’s, UN report finds
byline: Jobs traditionally done by women are more vulnerable to the impact of artificial intelligence than those done by men, especially in high-income countries, a report by the United Nations’ International Labour Organization showed on Tuesday.

title: J’pura Hospital continues to incur losses, COPE reveals
byline: It has been revealed at the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) that the Sri Jayewardenepura Hospital continues to operate under a loss.

title: Issues in new trainee teachers appointments due to deficiencies in existing system - PM
byline: The Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the recruitment of trainee teachers has been carried out in accordance with the prevailing system, and some issues have arisen due to the shortcomings of the existing system that are now being addressed.
